getEditorHelper

protected abstract IEditorHelper getEditorHelper(IPath filePath)
Get the editor helper used in setting the cursor position before breakpoints are toggled. Subclasses should implement this method to return an editor helper capable of placing the cursor

Parameters:
filePath - - Not necessarily used. Here in case a subclass needs more information to determine the type of editor helper to return
Returns:
IEditorHelpr - The file-specific editor helper

public void resumeDebugging(IUIContext ui)
Parameters:

setLineBreakpoint

public void setLineBreakpoint(IUIContext ui,
                              IPath filePath,
                              int breakpointLine)
setLineBreakpoint - Add a breakpoint to the given file on the given line.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - The full path (project included) of the file in which to set a breakpoint.
breakpointLine - - The line number (Eclipse files start numbering files with line number 1) on which to set a breakpoint. If the given line number is greater than the line length of the given file, this method will issue a test case failure. Note that if the line number is placed on a non-executable line (in a Java comment or on a line with a brace ('{') for a conditional statement, the breakpoint may not be set or may jump to the nearest possible executable line depending on internal Eclipse breakpoint processing and this method will issue a test case failure

switchPerspectiveOpenFile

protected void switchPerspectiveOpenFile(IUIContext ui,
                                         IPath filePath)
switchPerspectiveOpenFile - Utility to prepare a file for setting breakpoints by opening the file and opening the DEBUG perspective.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) of the file to open

verifyLineBreakpointExists

public void verifyLineBreakpointExists(IUIContext ui,
                                       IPath filePath,
                                       int breakpointLine,
                                       boolean exists)
verifyLineBreakpointExists - Wait for a line breakpoint in the given file and the given line to have the given expected existence.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) of the file whose breakpoints (if any) are to be verified
breakpointLine - - The line number of the file to search for a breakpoint
boolean - exists - True if the breakpoint exists, false otherwise

verifySuspendedAtBreakpoint

protected void verifySuspendedAtBreakpoint(IUIContext ui,
                                           DebuggingHelperImlAdapter.BreakpointInfo breakpoint)
verifySuspendedAtBreakpoint - Wait until a debugged process exists and is suspended at the given breakpoint. It is the responsibility of the caller to begin a process in debug mode, and to resume a suspended process.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
breakpoint - - Describes the breakpoint we're looking for
